newsitem.title: POLAND: POLISH INSURER PZU LIFE LIFTS Q1 NET TO PLN 61 MLN.
newsitem.headline: POLISH INSURER PZU LIFE LIFTS Q1 NET TO PLN 61 MLN.

text.p: Poland's largest life insurer, Powszechny Zaklad Ubezpieczen na Zycie SA (PZU Zycie), lifted first quarter net profit to 61 million zlotys from 40 million in the same period last year, the firm's deputy president said.
Halina Cwikilewicz told a Thursday news conference that first quarter pre-tax profit grew to 90 million from 54 million zlotys and gross premium to 665 million from 506 million.
Investment revenue rose to 162 million zlotys from 119 million and technical result to 74 million from 44 million.
Cwikilewicz said the firm had expected investment revenue of 603 million zlotys for all of 1997.

Audited 1996 results show PZU Life with a net profit of 100.9 million zlotys, pre-tax of 147.2 million, gross premium of 2.1 billion zlotys, investment revenue of 482.4 million and technical result of 80.8 million.
Own capital was at 359 million at the end of the first quarter versus 297.8 million at the end of 1996 and 266 million zlotys at the end of the first quarter last year.
Cwikilewicz said the 31 percent first quarter gross premium growth was a good sign given that the firm plans 27 percent growth for the whole year.

PZU Zycie president Wladyslaw Jamrozy told the conference that the firm expected to lift the percentage of its portfolio in recently launched individual insurance policies to 15 percent by year-end from the current 10 percent.
"For the first time we're leaders in individual insurance," Jamrozy said, referring to premiums collected in Poland.
He said the firm also planned to launch a broad health insurance programme later this year insuring about 1,500 possible events.
PZU Zycie, a subsidiary of Poland's largest non-life insurer PZU SA, has 77 percent of the country's life insurance market. -- Steven Silber +48 22 653 9700
